Academic Preparation Kit

Dear Participants,

Contained in this website is the academic preparation kit for IF Vienna 2016. Before arriving at the session, it is vital that you prepare yourself. Coming up with a solution to a problem you know nothing about is fairly difficult, so we have put together this academic preparation kit for you which outlines both the topics at the session and the EU as a whole. You should at the very least read your own topic overview - but the preparation does not end there. Included in all the overviews are links for further research - these are a good starting point to widen your view on the topic. The more effort you put into preparing yourself, the more you can contribute to your committee and its resolution at the session.

Happy reading!

The Chairs

The EU's Institutions - An Overview

Topic Overviews

AFET I

Transforming the Balkans

What further steps should be taken in order to help facilitate post conflict transformation processes in Balkan countries?

AFET II

Russia - Western Relations

With relations between Russia and the West severely strained by the conflict in Ukraine, how can trust be built between the regions to help defuse tensions and move towards a normalisation of relations?

AFET III

Tackling ISIS

The rise of the so-called Islamic State needs little introduction, yet the progress on identifying and combatting the sources of its support and infrastructure leaves much to be desired. What measures should be taken in order to tackle financial, structural and moral support of the group?

CRIM

Fighting illegal drugs and organised crime

Illegal drug trade in the EU is estimated to be worth as high as 100 billion dollars. Following the adoption of the 2013-2020 EU Drugs Strategy, what additional measures should European Institutions take to help Member States in the fight against illegal drug markets run by organised crime groups?

DEVE

Combatting Corruption

Rethinking public policies: How should the OSCE contribute to the implementation of good governance principles on local, national and international levels? Which steps should be taken to combat corruption?

DROI

Integration of the Roma People

There is persistent discrimination of the Roma minority by local authorities and national governments across Europe. What should be done to resolve the tensions surrounding the Roma people and to integrate them more into European and other societies?

FEMM

Improving Women's Reproductive Health

The role of services and the support of partners and communities in family planning: what measures should be taken to ensure women have better control over their sexual and reproductive lives and and are provided with consistent access to basic support and services pertaining to reproductive health?

LIBE I

Europe's Immigration Crisis

Given the recent flow of migrants into Europe, how should the plight of all kinds of migrants be balanced against increasing public concern about the impact of further immigration?

LIBE II

Freedom of Movement in Europe

How can the principles behind and benefits of the Schengen area be fostered and the inclusion of migrants in the labour market be promoted given restrictions to tackle free movement and the closing of borders across Europe?

SEDE I

European Intelligence Cooperation

“Terrorists know no borders, our security services do,” said Former Prime Minister of Belgium Guy Verhofstadt in March 2016. How should the exchange of intelligence within the European Union, as well as cooperation with non-European intelligence services, be improved?

AFET I

Post conflict transformations in Balkan countries

What further steps should be taken in order to help facilitate post conflict transformation processes in Balkan countries?
